simulated_ratings.title: Postman, The (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The post-apocalyptic hopefulness appealed, but the delivery felt heavy-handed and overlong.

simulated_ratings.title: Chariots of Fire (1981)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stirring, dignified inspiration with a soulful pulse that stuck with me.

simulated_ratings.title: Emma (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Witty, warm, and charming enough to make the matchmaking mischief delightful.

simulated_ratings.title: Sense and Sensibility (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Graceful and heartfelt, with emotions and manners that really landed.

simulated_ratings.title: Waking Ned Devine (a.k.a. Waking Ned) (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cozy, clever, and full of community spirit that made me grin.

simulated_ratings.title: Jesus Christ Superstar (1973)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bold and intriguing, though the rock-opera style isn’t fully my groove.

simulated_ratings.title: Persuasion (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quietly romantic and mature in a way I really appreciated.

simulated_ratings.title: Big Bully (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Mean-spirited and flat, with little charm to soften the edges.

simulated_ratings.title: Apostle, The (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A flawed man’s fervor made for compelling, human drama.

simulated_ratings.title: Gods Must Be Crazy, The (1980)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gentle laughs and a sweet spirit, even if a bit dated.

simulated_ratings.title: Napoleon Dynamite (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quirky deadpan that left me more bemused than charmed.

simulated_ratings.title: Persuasion (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Still affecting, though less textured and luminous than the earlier take.

simulated_ratings.title: Strictly Ballroom (1992)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Fizzy, feel-good momentum with satisfying underdog sparkle.

simulated_ratings.title: Dish, The (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Neat idea, but too slight to leave much of an impression.

simulated_ratings.title: English Patient, The (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lush and tragic, sometimes slow, but emotionally rewarding.

simulated_ratings.title: Wish Upon a Star (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cute body-swap fun, yet pretty disposable for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Babe (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tender, funny, and quietly profound—an easy smile-maker.

simulated_ratings.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Broad but affectionate laughs with a big, beating heart.

simulated_ratings.title: Cinderella (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Pleasant and tuneful, if more charming than memorable.

simulated_ratings.title: Gone with the Wind (1939)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grand and sweeping, though its excess could be wearying.

simulated_ratings.title: Midnight Diner (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gentle, savory slices of life that warmed me up.

simulated_ratings.title: Wiz, The (1978)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Inventive in spots, but the magic didn’t fully click for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Pride and Prejudice (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Informative enough, but a behind-the-scenes feature holds limited appeal.

simulated_ratings.title: What the #$*! Do We Know!? (a.k.a. What the Bleep Do We Know!?) (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Big questions, but the pop-philosophy sheen didn’t convince me.

simulated_ratings.title: I Feel Pretty (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweet message with uneven laughs, pleasant overall.

simulated_ratings.title: Nacho Libre (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Goofy heart and Jack Black charm made it hard not to smile.

simulated_ratings.title: Emma (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stylish and playful, though it held me at a polite distance.

simulated_ratings.title: Horse Whisperer, The (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Earnest and scenic, a bit slow but quietly moving.

simulated_ratings.title: Yentl (1983)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Soulful songs and a sincere story of identity won me over.

simulated_ratings.title: Crossing Guard, The (1995)
